content:
[START OF THE EXAMPLE]
Task Description: Your task is to boil water. For compounds without a boiling point, combusting the substance is also acceptable. First, focus on the substance. Then, take actions that will cause it to change its state of matter.

Thought: Before initiating any actions, I need to assess my surroundings to gather information about the environment I'm in. By looking around, I can observe the substances available and identify any objects or equipment that might help me achieve my goal of boiling water. This initial step is crucial for formulating a plan and determining the next course of action.
Action: look around

Observation: This room is called the hallway. In it, you see: 
	a picture
	a substance called air
	the agent
You also see:
	A door to the green house (that is open)
	A door to the living room (that is open)
	A door to the art studio (that is open)
	A door to the kitchen (that is open)
	A door to the bedroom (that is open)
	A door to the workshop (that is open)

Thought: To solve the task, I need to be in same location as water and have substance alone in a single container
Action: open door to kitchen
Observation: The door is already open.
Action: go kitchen
Observation: You move to the kitchen.
Action: pick up thermometer
Observation: You move the thermometer to the inventory.
Action: open cupboard
Observation: The cupboard is now open.
Action: pick up metal pot
Observation: You move the metal pot to the inventory.
Action: move metal pot to sink
Observation: You move the metal pot to the sink.
Action: activate sink
Observation: The sink is now activated.

Thought: Now I am in same location as water and have substance alone in a single container. Next, I need to focus on substance and make sure substance is in a liquid state
Action: deactivate sink
Observation: The sink is now deactivated.
Action: pick up metal pot
Observation: You move the metal pot to the inventory.
Action: focus on substance in metal pot
Observation: You focus on the water.

Thought: Now I focus on substance and make sure substance is in a liquid state. Next, I need to have object on heater (stove)
Action: pour metal pot into metal pot
Observation: You can't move something into itself.
Action: pick up metal pot
Observation: You move the metal pot to the inventory.
Action: move metal pot to stove
Observation: You move the metal pot to the stove.

Thought: Now I have object on heater (stove). Next, I need to activate heater (stove)
Action: activate stove
Observation: The stove is now activated.

Thought: Now I activate heater (stove). Next, I need to heat object by at least 20C
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 13 degrees celsius
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 20 degrees celsius.
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 28 degrees celsius

Thought: Now I heat object by at least 20C. Next, I need to make sure substance is in a gaseous state (or combusting)
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 38 degrees celsius
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 48 degrees celsius
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 58 degrees celsius
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 68 degrees celsius
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 78 degrees celsius
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 88 degrees celsius
Action: examine substance in metal pot
Observation: a substance called water
Action: use thermometer in inventory on substance in metal pot
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 98 degrees celsius

Thought: Now I make sure substance is in a gaseous state (or combusting). Next, I need to examine the steam.
Action: examine steam
Observation: a substance called steam
Action: use thermometer in inventory on steam
Observation: the thermometer measures a temperature of 107 degrees celsius
Action: wait1
Observation: You decide to wait for 1 iterations.
